text: Fredrick Pierce "Fred" Vaughan (October 8, 1904 - October 16, 1986)U.S. WWII Draft Cards Young Men, 1940-1947 The National Archives at Atlanta, Georgia; Atlanta, Georgia, USA; North Carolina World War II Draft Registration Cards; Record Group: RG 147, Records of the Selective Service System, 1926-1975; Box: 376. was an All-Southern college football guard for the North Carolina State Wolfpack of North Carolina State University. One account reads "Vaughan is noted for his consistent playing week after week. He always is depended on and never fails to play his usual steady game. He is the main gun in the State line." ==Early years== Fred Vaughan was born on October 8, 1904 in Roanoke Rapids, North Carolina to Cornelius R. Vaughan and Carry Bell Gray. ==References== Category:NC State Wolfpack football players Category:American football guards Category:All-Southern college football players Category:1904 births Category:1986 deaths Category:Players of American football from North Carolina Category:People from Roanoke Rapids, North Carolina
title: Fred Vaughan
